entries.meaning: The act of thinking again about something.
examples: This business plan of yours looks risky. It needs a rethink.

verbs.description: rethink (third-person singular simple present rethinks, present participle rethinking, simple past and past participle rethought)

entries.meaning: To think again about something, with the intention of changing or replacing it.
examples: Disability rights advocates are encouraging people to rethink the words "crazy" and "insane" as they stigmatize mental health.
